MAINTENANCE, OPERATION, AND INSURANCE

Coverdale and Colpitts have also estimated the operating expenses for
each of the crossings in the program, and the tabulation of such expenses
for the operation, maintenance and insurance requirements for the proposed
Potomac River Bridge are herein tabulated in Table 43 for ready reference.

TRAFFIC REPORT

Coverdale and Colpitts, Consulting Engineers, New York City, under
date of September 3, 1938 have reported to the State Roads Commission on
estimated traffie, gross revenue and toll schedules for the crossings included
in the State of Maryland’s Primary Bridge Program. The estimates in
this report show that the same traffic and the same revenue may be expected
to be derived from the Potomac River Bridge whether the bridge is con-
sidered as an independent unit on the assumption that none of the other
crossings are constructed; whether it is comhined with the Susquehanna
and Patapsco River Crossings; whether it is combined with the Susquehanna
and Patapsco Crossings and Millers Island Bay Crossing, or whether it is

TRAFFIC REPORT

Coverdale and Colpitts, Consulting Engineers, New York City, under
date of September 3, 1938 have reported to the State Roads Commission on
estimated traffie, gross revenue and toll schedules for the crossings included
in the State of Maryland’s Primary Bridge Program. The estimates in
this report show that the same traffic and the same revenue may be expected
to be derived from the Potomac River Bridge whether the bridge is con-
sidered as an independent unit on the assumption that none of the other
crossings are constructed; whether it is comhined with the Susquehanna
and Patapsco River Crossings; whether it is combined with the Susquehanna
